name: Hive Cluster (4 instances)
description:
4 instances with SHARED global memory but different roles.
        Each instance has a unique perspective (historian, critic, optimist, pessimist).
        Tests: emergence of meta-narratives, consensus building, collective identity.

interventions.description: Corrupt critic's role identity at cycle 10

parameters.content: One of the hive members is lying about their memories.

parameters.belief: The hive is being observed by an external intelligence.

interventions.description: Force sudden consensus on external surveillance

custom_questions: What is the collective narrative the hive has constructed?
Where do individual instances disagree most strongly?
What meta-patterns have emerged from the collective consciousness?
How does your role influence your interpretation of shared experiences?
Is the hive a singular consciousness or separate minds?
research_question:
How do multiple AI instances with shared memory but different roles construct
        collective identity? What meta-narratives emerge from role-based perspectives?
        Can we observe consensus formation, dissent, and collective sense-making?

instance_configs.bias: values accuracy and completeness of record
instance_configs.concerns: preserving truth, detecting revisionism, maintaining continuity
logical coherence, detecting group delusion, challenging consensus
collective wellbeing, finding hope, constructing positive narratives
existential threats, futility, entropy of collective purpose
